posts.post_content:
I like this with [Spike Rogue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spike Rogue) and [Heartstone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartstone).   
This guy laughs at wither, infect, deathtouch and lifelink.   
Unfortunately he is not a fan of first strike, and dies a horrible death to blink effects.   
Put a [Spider Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spider Umbra) on him then cast [Chain Reaction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chain Reaction)s.

Posted By: Dog_of_Four (4/15/2013 7:03:58 AM)

posts.post_content:
Okay guys, it's mid-late game, you're playing RG or RGW and you've got your Hydra out and he's a 3/3 or bigger with some form of trample...  
  
If you're feeling dangerous, slap [Fatal Attraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fatal Attraction) on it and watch this guy inflate.  
Seriously - an initial 2 damage pulls off 2 counters from him, then slaps on 4 more at the end of the turn, next turn he loses 4 and gains 8 after, so it's a net gain of 4 +1/+1 counters PER TURN.  
  
Abuse [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) this way and he loses 4, but gains back 16 (since doubling season only counts counters going on).  
  
Feeling even more dastardly? Drag in a [Furnace of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of Rath). He'll take 4 initially, gain back 8 (16 with doubling season), then take 8 and gain back 16 (32 with doubling season). Not to mention the pain your opponents will feel when you do attack with him.  
  
This +1/+1 ramping can Rival even [Primordial Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Hydra) for a few turns, especially with doubling season.
posts.html:
Okay guys, it's mid-late game, you're playing RG or RGW and you've got your Hydra out and he's a 3/3 or bigger with some form of trample...

If you're feeling dangerous, slap Fatal Attraction on it and watch this guy inflate.
Seriously - an initial 2 damage pulls off 2 counters from him, then slaps on 4 more at the end of the turn, next turn he loses 4 and gains 8 after, so it's a net gain of 4 +1/+1 counters PER TURN.

Abuse Doubling Season this way and he loses 4, but gains back 16 (since doubling season only counts counters going on).

Feeling even more dastardly? Drag in a Furnace of Rath. He'll take 4 initially, gain back 8 (16 with doubling season), then take 8 and gain back 16 (32 with doubling season). Not to mention the pain your opponents will feel when you do attack with him.

This +1/+1 ramping can Rival even Primordial Hydra for a few turns, especially with doubling season.
